content:
Hey all, we have a PR open to rustc-hash to better support no-std targets here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-hash/pull/9

Does anyone know the right person to ping to get this approved/merged/released? It would definitely help out some embedded folks.

CC @Nick Cameron @nikomatsakis who seem to be owners/contributors to the crate
Thank you @simulacrum for handling! Would it be possible to cut a release as well? (thank you in advance if you're already on it!)
Let me take a look, not sure if I have rights
Looks like I should... so yes, will do so in a bit, let's resolve the no_std issue first though
I think the primary pain was just shared build-dependencies/dependencies wrt byteorder, but if we can now make the crate no_std, even better!
We'd not be able to re-export FxHashMap/FxHashSet without std, but that seems fine
@simulacrum did you issue a new crates.io release?
not yet, going to get the no_std changes in first
but will do so after that unless you don't want me to?
@James Munns Published 1.1.0 with no_std and byteorder dropped
